FuncDef:
The set flexe sub-time-slot granula command sets a sub-timeslot granularity for a subcard.
The undo set flexe sub-time-slot granula command deletes the sub-timeslot granularity configured for a subcard.
By default, the sub-timeslot granularity for a subcard is 5 Gbit/s.
CLIs: set flexe sub-time-slot granula slot <slot-id> card <card-id> { 1g | 1.25g | 5g }
undo set flexe sub-time-slot granula slot <slot-id> card <card-id> [ 1g | 1.25g | 5g ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the subcard ID.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 4294967295.

Sets the sub-timeslot granularity to 1 Gbit/s.
-

Sets the sub-timeslot granularity to 1.25 Gbit/s.
-

Retains the default sub-timeslot granularity of 5 Gbit/s.
-

Specifies the slot ID of a board.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Examples: [~HUAWEI] set flexe sub-time-slot granula slot 1 card 2 1G
[~HUAWEI] undo set flexe sub-time-slot granula slot 1 card 2
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When the bandwidth value set for a FlexE client on a subcard is less than 5 Gbit/s, run the set flexe sub-time-slot granula command to configure a sub-timeslot granularity for the subcard.A sub-timeslot granularity is planned as needed:
If the sub-timeslot granularity uses the default value of 5 Gbit/s, the bandwidth value of a FlexE client is an integer multiple of 5 Gbit/s, such as 5 Gbit/s, 10 Gbit/s, 15 Gbit/s, and so on.If the sub-timeslot granularity is set to 1 Gbit/s, the bandwidth value of a FlexE client is 1 Gbit/s, 2 Gbit/s, 3 Gbit/s, 4 Gbit/s, or an integer multiple of 5 Gbit/s.If the sub-timeslot granularity is set to 1 Gbit/s, the bandwidth value of a FlexE client is 1.25 Gbit/s, 2.5 Gbit/s, 3.75 Gbit/s, or an integer multiple of 5 Gbit/s.

Precautions
If the FlexE client has been bound bandwidth, the undo set flexe sub-time-slot granula command cannot be executed on the subcard.
